text: is there an openapi file?
I'm trying to use HubSpot within power automate but it requires an OpenAPI definition file to get started.
I see HubSpot uses OpenAPI internally but provides no access to this for external people, thats a shame.

<https://github.com/ksvirkou-HubSpot/openapi-generator>
<https://github.com/uyermolkin-HubSpot/openapi-generator>
<https://github.com/atanasiuk-HubSpot/openapi-generator>
clearly it exists and is being used internally so why not publish an OpenAPI definition file for devs to use?

Hi <@U01L1QNLMUJ> We haven’t yet added this to our docs (that’s in progress) but in the meantime. <https://api.hubapi.com/api-catalog-public/v1/apis|This API> can get you all the Open API specs we use to generate our client libraries
ty
<@UFBNA9K9A> it seems azure doesnt support openapiv3
OpenAPI 3.0 schema definitions are not supported. Please try again with an OpenAPI 2.0 definition.
:disappointed:

Weird, it seems like this should have been rolled out a year ago according to this article: <https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/updates/openapi-v3-support-in-azure-api-management-is-now-generally-available/>
unless it’s a separate feature, I’m not super familiar with Azure

Anyone facing form submission errors even though the scope is present?

`This oauth-token (token) does not have proper permissions! (requires all of [form-submissions-write])`

Scopes for the token
```  "user": "user_email",
    "hub_domain": "domain_name",
    "scopes": [
        "contacts",
        "content",
        "automation",
        "timeline",
        "oauth",
        "forms",
        "files",
        "hubdb",
        "transactional-email",
        "integration-sync"
    ],```
<@UFBNA9K9A> is there a openapi 2.0 or swagger definition?
No, we only have v3
so power automate on azure is a no go then :disappointed:
I suppose you could try and download the file and manually change the version because it’s mostly backwards compatible but that’s pretty hacky
lol i'll try 1 sec
nope
not as backwards compatible as I hoped. Sorry I don’t have a solution for you
wait theres a way around it
if you convert the openapiv3 json to yaml it works
Hey <@UN16CJ5GA> We just reverted the deploy that we believed caused this issue. Can you try again and let me know if that resolved it?
Yep, I was just talking to my team, errors started from 10:30EST and ended at 11:24EST. Thank you for the update <@UFBNA9K9A> !

Hello <#C2YHAHB6K|api> channel. I wanted to reach out and see what is the best way (if possible) to setup a quick 10-20 minute meeting with HubSpot API developers? Thanks in advanced for any info. I can share  more info with whomever I would be speaking with. It is in regards to rate limits retrieving all contacts data. Have a great weekend everyone!

Hello! I am working with the API endpoints to subscribe and unsubscribe individuals from marketing emails, and I am stuck. I see documentation saying that it is not possible to subscriber a user to marketing emails once they have been unsubscribed (<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/email/resubscribe-contacts-to-your-marketing-emails>). Is it true that there is no way to do this programmatically? I have also posted my question here: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Communication-Preferences-quot-cannot-be-updated-because-they/td-p/406603>
